radiographic_examinations.findings: Annular constriction (3 to 4 cm in length) with irregular mucosal contours involving the distal esophagus and gastroesophageal junction, suggestive of esophageal cancer.

Intense 18F-fluorodeoxyglucose (FDG) uptake involving the distal esophagus and gastroesophageal junction, as well as lymphadenopathy with intense FDG uptake in mediastinal, retrocrural, and retroperitoneal regions.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Initial findings suggest intense FDG uptake, which later showed evidence of disease progression with similar intense uptake after treatment with FOLFOX and radiation therapy.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: CT of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis
radiographic_examinations.date: After treatment with FOLFOX and radiation therapy
radiographic_examinations.findings: Decreased thickening of the esophageal wall and diminishing mediastinal and retroperitoneal lymphadenopathy.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Suggestive of a response to treatment.

radiographic_examinations.findings: Evidence of disease progression, including multiple hepatic, pulmonary, and adrenal metastases with intense FDG uptake.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Indicated worsening disease after initial improvement.

radiographic_examinations.procedure_name: Follow-up PET-CT after therapy with MET inhibitor
radiographic_examinations.findings: Marked response to treatment indicated by resolution of hepatic, adrenal, pulmonary, and nodal metastases.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Showed a radiographic complete response since the eighth month of treatment.
